'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[Multinational corporation|multinational]] [[software]] [[corporation]], first [[Incorporation|incorporated]] as a [[Private company|privately held corporation]] in September, 1998, that designs and manages the [[Internet]]'s top rated search engine.
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[Multinational corporation|multinational]] [[software]] [[corporation]], first [[Incorporation|incorporated]] as a [[Private company|privately held corporation]] in September, 1998, that designs and manages the [[Internet]]'s top rated search engine.
With a market capitalization of [[United States dollar|US$]]117.6 billion as of late [[2005]], Google is the largest internet search company in the world, twice as large as arch-rival [[Yahoo!]]<ref>Khan, Kim; Blaine, Charley. "[http://moneycentral.msn.com/content/CNBCTV/Articles/Dispatches/P136522.asp Google stock tops $400, worth $117 billion]." ''[[MSN|MSN Money]].'' [[November 17]], [[2005]].</ref> The company employs approximately 6,800 employees and is based in [[Mountain View, California]]. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Eric Schmidt]], formerly [[chief executive officer]] of [[Novell]], was named Google's CEO when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down.
With a market capitalization of [[United States dollar|US$]]117.6 billion as of late [[2005]], Google is the largest internet search company in the world, twice as large as arch-rival [[Yahoo!]]<ref>Khan, Kim; Blaine, Charley. "[http://moneycentral.msn.com/content/CNBCTV/Articles/Dispatches/P136522.asp Google stock tops $400, worth $117 billion]." ''[[MSN|MSN Money]].'' [[November 17]], [[2005]].</ref> The company employs approximately 6,800 employees and is based in [[Mountain View, California]]. [[Eric E. Schmidt|Eric Schmidt]], formerly [[chief executive officer]] of [[Novell]], was named Google's CEO when co-founder [[Lawrence E. Page|Larry Page]] stepped down.
â
The name "Google" originated from a misspelling of "[[googol]]," <ref>Koller, David. "[http://graphics.stanford.edu/~dk/google_name_origin.html Origin of the name, "Google."] ''[[Stanford University]].'' January, [[2004]].</ref> which refers to 10<sup>100</sup>(a 1 followed by one-hundred zeros). Google has become well known for its corporate culture and innovative, clean products, and has a major impact on online culture. The verb "[[Google (verb)|to google]]" has come to mean "to perform a Web search", usually with the [[Google search|Google]] [[search engine]].
+
The name "yahoo " originated from a misspelling of "[[googol]]," <ref>Koller, David. "[http://graphics.stanford.edu/~dk/google_name_origin.html Origin of the name, "Google."] ''[[Stanford University]].'' January, [[2004]].</ref> which refers to 10<sup>100</sup>(a 1 followed by one-hundred zeros). Google has become well known for its corporate culture and innovative, clean products, and has a major impact on online culture. The verb "[[Google (verb)|to google]]" has come to mean "to perform a Web search", usually with the [[Google search|Google]] [[search engine]].
â
Google's services are run on several [[server farm]]s, which, in [[2004]], consisted of over 30 clusters of up to 2,000 PCs per cluster. Each cluster contains one [[petabyte]] of data with sustained transfer rates of 2 [[Gigabit per second|Gbps]]. Combined, over four billion web pages, averaging 10 Kb each, have been fully indexed.<ref name="servers">Loney, Matt. "[http://www.zdnet.co.uk/insight/hardware/0,39020433,39175560,00.htm The magic that makes Google tick]." ''[[ZDNet|ZDNet UK]].'' [[December 1]], [[2004]].</ref>
+
yahoo's services are run on several [[server farm]]s, which, in [[2004]], consisted of over 30 clusters of up to 2,000 PCs per cluster. Each cluster contains one [[petabyte]] of data with sustained transfer rates of 2 [[Gigabit per second|Gbps]]. Combined, over four web pages, averaging 10 bytes each, have been fully indexed.<ref name="servers">Loney, Matt. "[http://www.zdnet.co.uk/insight/hardware/0,39020433,39175560,00.htm The magic that makes Google tick]." ''[[ZDNet|ZDNet UK]].'' [[December 1]], [[2004]].</ref>
